Name Rascal/Libraries/Vis/Figure/Figures/grid

Function grid(list[list[Figure]] figs, FProperty props...)
Description Layout figures in a grid. Place figures on a fixed grid. The width property determines the horizontal size of the grid while the vertical size is determined automatically. The hgap and vgap properties determine the distance between grid points.
Examples b1 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Red")); b2 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Blue")); b3 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Yellow")); b4 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Green")); b5 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Purple")); b6 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Orange")); b7 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Silver")); render(grid([b1, b2, b3, b4, b5, b6, b7], width(200), gap(100)));

gives:





Varying the sizes of b2 and b5: b1 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Red")); b2 = box(size(60,30), fillColor("Blue")); b3 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Yellow")); b4 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Green")); b5 = box(size(80,80), fillColor("Purple")); b6 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Orange")); b7 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Silver")); render(grid([b1, b2, b3, b4, b5, b6, b7], width(200), gap(100)));

gives:





Varying the alignment of b2 and b5 gives: b1 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Red")); b2 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Blue"), left(), top()); b3 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Yellow")); b4 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Green")); b5 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Purple"), bottom(), right()); b6 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Orange")); b7 = box(size(50,50), fillColor("Silver")); render(grid([b1, b2, b3, b4, b5, b6, b7], width(200), gap(100)));

gives:

Pitfalls The distance between grid points does not include the size of the figures that are placed on the grid points. If overlaps of figures are not desired, then the horizontal (or vertical) gap size should be larger than the largest width (height) of the figures to be placed on the grid.
